thread.title: Paris attractions: eight of the city's best lesser-known places to visit
thread.title_full: Paris attractions: eight of the city's best lesser-known places to visit

author: Natasha Edwards
title: Paris attractions: eight of the city's best lesser-known places to visit
text:
Comments 
Fed up with queues for the Eiffel Tower, scrums in the Louvre, and crowds at the Sacré-Cœur? 
Our Paris expert Natasha Edwards - a resident of the city for almost 20 years - has picked eight of her favourite lesser-known spots, including things to do and places to eat and shop. 
They include the Eglise St-Etienne-du-Mont, which features the shrine of Saint Geneviève, patron saint of Paris, who saved the city from invasion by Attila the Hun in 451, La Conciergerie, home to the cell where Marie-Antoinette was imprisoned, and the restaurant L'Encrier, one of the French capital's best-kept budget secrets. 
For more tips on visiting the city, see her complete expert guide to Paris . It includes the best hotels , restaurants, bars and shops, with options for all budgets.
